medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe progeroid features associated with mandibuloacral dysplasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed mandibular hypoplasia during infancy, with joint stiffness, skin thinning, and mottled hyperpigmentation at 15 months. At 3 years, progressive clavicular hypoplasia, acroosteolysis, and significant hair loss from the temporal and occipital areas were noted. Continued obstruction of cranial sutures and prominent lipodystrophy was observed at 5 years. GH therapy from 3 to 7 years did not improve short stature. Severe joint contractures led to abnormal posture and reduced mobility.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient experienced failure to thrive from one year of age, gastroesophageal issues, and had two extra lower incisors that required removal.
medical_history.family_history: The patient belongs to a consanguineous pedigree; both parents were heterozygous for the LMNA mutation but showed no skeletal anomalies or progeroid features.
